definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: To conclude, I wish you every success in your work, happiness for you and your families, and good luck in everything.
sentences.chinese: 最後，祝大家工作順利，闔家幸福，萬事如意。

sentences.english: Just be yourself, and do what you like.
sentences.chinese: 雖然橋段很老套，不過還是很適合闔家歡樂的。

sentences.english: At last, In the coming new year , wish all the members good health and happiness!
sentences.chinese: 最後，祝大家在新的一年裏，闔家歡樂，萬事如意。

sentences.english: Smooth work, family happiness and everythings success.
sentences.chinese: 任務順利，闔家幸福，萬事如意。

sentences.english: Today is Lantern Festival. First of all, I wish you and your family a happy festival!
sentences.chinese: 今天是元宵節，首先祝巨匠節日歡愉，闔家團聚。

definition: abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
taking everyone along, young and old/to look after the elderly and the young
poe divination, a traditional Chinese divination method where a pair of crescent-shaped wooden or bamboo blocks is thrown on the ground, with the positions of the blocks determining the divine answer
our peasant friends (political term used in the early years of the Old Democratic Revolution, 1840-1919)/(Tw) (coll.) farmer
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
